listings.Scheme Name: Financial Assistance To Disabled Students Pursuing (10th, 11th, 12th Equivalent Exams)
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Differently-abled students with 40% or more disability
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Kerala State. 2. The differently abled students with 40% or more disability are eligible to apply under the scheme. 3. Financial assistance will be provided to students falling in Above Poverty Line (APL) as well as Below Poverty Line (BPL) categories.
listings.Description & Benefits: Under the scheme, financial assistance will be provided to such school dropouts to pursue SSLC, +1, +2 equivalent courses implemented by State Literacy Mission. The benefits include course fee assistance, exam fee assistance, registration fee assistance, and admission fee assistance.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process. The applicant needs to visit the nearest Anganwadi Centre or District Social Justice Office and collect the application form. The application form can also be downloaded from the official website of the Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala. The application may be submitted to the District Social Justice Officers (DSJOs) or the concerned Anganwadi Centre.
listings.Tags: APL, BPL, Disabled, Financial Assistance, PwD, Student

listings.Scheme Name: ICMR- Post Doctoral Fellowship
listings.Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Health & Family Welfare
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Fresh PhDs/MD/MS holders
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Indian nationals only, Fresh PhDs/MD/MS within three years of completing their Ph.D./MD/MS degree, Maximum age limit is 32 years, relaxable up to 5 years in case of SC/ST/OBC/PH and women candidates
listings.Description & Benefits: Fellowship to foster high-quality research opportunities in cutting-edge areas of basic science, communicable and non-communicable diseases, and reproductive health including nutrition at ICMR Institutes /Centers, Consolidated fellowship of ₹65,000/- per month plus House Rent Allowance (HRA) and Non-Practicing allowance (NPA), Contingency grant of ₹3,00,000/- per annum
listings.Application Process: Offline, Last Date of Application (30th June and 31st December Every Year), Application form can be downloaded from ICMR website, Completed application should be accompanied by all the requisite documents and attach self-attested photocopies of all documents as required, Applications should be sent to Director General, ICMR Headquarters, Ansari Nagar, New Delhi-110029
listings.Tags: Research, Fellowship, Medical Research, Post Doctoral

listings.Scheme Name: Tool Kit Grant for Traditional Handicrafts Experts
listings.Ministries/Departments: Backward Communities Development Department, Government of Kerala
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Traditional OBC craftsmen
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Kerala State, belong to the State Backward Communities of Kerala State, be engaged in traditional craftwork/skilled work, have an upper age limit of 60 years, and have an annual family income of ₹1,00,000/-.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides modern skill training and Tool Kits to traditional OBC craftsmen to improve their productivity and competitiveness, ensuring quality goods for enhanced income and qualitative improvement in their living conditions. The grant of ₹25000/- shall be given to the eligible person for his/her training, stipend (if found necessary) and tool kits.
listings.Application Process: Offline application through prescribed form with all relevant documents to be submitted to the Regional Deputy Director.
listings.Tags: Craftsman, Grant, Handicrafts, OBC, Self-employment, Stipend, Tool Kit, Training

listings.Scheme Name: Snehasanthwanam
listings.Ministries/Departments: Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Endosulfan victims in the state of Kerala
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Kerala State. The applicant should be an Endosulfan victim.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme acts as a relief measure for the Endosulfan victims in the state of Kerala. Under this scheme, financial assistance has been granted from December 2010 onwards to the Endosulfan victims. This scheme also aims to provide educational assistance to the Children of Endosulfan-affected families. In addition to this, Kerala Social Security Mission is now providing monthly assistance of ₹700/- per month to the caregivers of Endosulfan victims who are fully bedridden or mentally retarded under the special Aswasakiranam scheme.
listings.Application Process: Offline. To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the application duly filled out should be submitted to the Kasaragod District Collector Office. The applicant may also visit Kerala Social Security Mission offices or the Social Justice Department in Kerala.
listings.Tags: Endosulfan, Financial Assistance, Educational Assistance, Bedridden, Victim, Kerala

listings.Scheme Name: Scheme for Grant of Additional Scholarship to the Students of Other Backward Classes of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, for Pursuing Higher Studies Anywhere in India after Secondary Level (Except Class XI & XII)
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Welfare, Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands
listings.Target Beneficiaries: OBC students belonging to the non-creamy layer of Andaman & Nicobar Islands
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Students who belong to OBCs so specified and notified in relation to Andaman and Nicobar Islands and are domicile of Andaman & Nicobar Islands and who have passed Secondary (Class X)/Senior Secondary (Class XII) from a recognized Board of School Education and pursuing higher education in a recognized Institution/University
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides additional financial assistance (Scholarship) to the OBC students belonging to the non-creamy layer of Andaman & Nicobar Islands for pursuing higher education after Secondary (X)/Senior Secondary (XII), in Government-recognized Polytechnic/ITI/College/University anywhere in India, as an incentive to supplement to the cost of their education.
listings.Application Process: Online submission of the application form can be done through the website of the National Scholarship Portal
listings.Tags: Higher Study, OBC, Scholarship, Student

listings.Scheme Name: National Family Benefit Scheme - Uttar Pradesh
listings.Ministries/Departments: Uttar Pradesh Government
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Below-poverty-line families who have lost their lead earners
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be aged between 18 years to 60 years. 2. The family income should not be more than Rs. 56, 450/- in urban areas and Rs. 46, 080/- in rural areas.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a lump sum amount of Rs. 30, 000/- as compensation to the families who have lost their lead earners. The scheme is for below-poverty-line families.
listings.Application Process: The application process is available only online. The applicants need to visit the official website, download the application form, fill it out, and submit it along with the required documents.
listings.Tags: Financial Assistance, Death Relief Benefit, Below Poverty Line Families, Uttar Pradesh Government

listings.Scheme Name: Dr. Ambedakar Centrally Sponsored Scheme of Post-Matric Scholarships for the Economically Backward Class (EBC) Students
listings.Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Economically Backward Class (EBC) students studying at the post-matriculation or post-secondary stage
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Indian nationals belonging to the General Category (Other than Schedule Caste, Schedule Tribe and Other Backward Classes), with income from all sources not exceeding ₹ 1,00,000 per annum
listings.Description & Benefits: Financial assistance to complete education, including maintenance allowance, reader charges for blind students, fees, study tours, and thesis typing/printing charges
listings.Application Process: Online application through National Scholarship Portal, with required documents and certificates
listings.Tags: EBC, Post Matric, Scholarship, Student

listings.Scheme Name: Financial Assistance under Odisha Working Journalist Welfare Scheme
listings.Ministries/Departments: Information & Public Relations Department, Government of Odisha
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Legal heirs of working journalists in Odisha
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. Journalist should be working in Odisha. 2. The Journalist should be working for a media house registered with the I&PR department, Odisha. 3. The applicant should be a legal heir of the working journalist in case of his/her death or in case of permanent incapacitation.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to the legal heir of a working journalist in case of his/her death, and in case of permanent incapacitation. In the event of death of a working journalist, a fixed sum of money may be paid to the widow, and in the event of the deceased not being survived by his widow, equally to the minor children.
listings.Application Process: Online application through the official web portal of the Odisha Working Journalist Welfare Scheme Application.
listings.Tags: Financial Assistance, Journalist, Death, Permanent Incapacitation, Odisha

listings.Scheme Name: Savitribai Jyotirao Phule Fellowship For Single Girl Child
listings.Ministries/Departments: Ministry of Education
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Single girl child, i.e. the only girl child in the family without having any brother or sister
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Any single girl child of her parents pursuing Ph.D. in any stream/subject in recognised Universities/Colleges/Institutes, registered herself in regular, full-time Ph. D. program, girl students up to the age of 40 years for general category and 45 years for the reserved categories i.e. SC/ST/OBC and PWD (Persons with Disabilities) as on the last date of submission of online application
listings.Description & Benefits: Fellowship scheme by the University Grants Commission (UGC), Department of Higher Education, for pursuing research work leading to the award of a Ph.D. degree, financial assistance, contingency, HRA, medical assistance, leave
listings.Application Process: Online application process, registration, login, dashboard, eligibility alert, eligibility, data capturing format, PG details, Ph.D. details, declaration
listings.Tags: Fellowship, Girl Child, Ph.D., Education, Research

listings.Scheme Name: Exposure Visits To The Assam Legislative Assembly
listings.Ministries/Departments: Parliamentary Affairs Department
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Students from High School up to College level
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Students from related subjects such as Political Science, Economics, etc. within the Arts/Humanities streams in colleges/higher secondary schools and social sciences in secondary schools. Selection is based on academic performance and enthusiastic participation in extracurricular activities.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides practical exposure to students by visiting the Assam Legislative Assembly and witnessing the legislative sessions, debates, and bill discussions. Students have the opportunity to interact with dignitaries such as the Hon'ble Speaker, Chief Minister, Ministers, MLAs, and senior officials. The scheme helps students understand the functioning of the State Legislative Assembly and the legislative process.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process. The selection of educational institutions and students is done in consultation with the respective District Collectors (DCs)/Inspectors of Schools.
listings.Tags: Assam, Legislative Assembly, Student Visits, Learning, Education

listings.Scheme Name: Scheme of Assistance for the Prevention of Alcoholism & Substance (Drugs) Abuse and for Social Defence Services: General Grant-in-Aid Programme for Financial Assistance in the Field of Social Defence
listings.Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Addicts, people affected by alcoholism and substance abuse
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Organizations with at least two years of experience in the related area or demonstrating competence to undertake the proposed scheme, registered societies, charitable non-profit-making companies, public trusts, non-official organizations involved in social welfare, and certain statutory bodies
listings.Description & Benefits: Creating awareness about the ill effects of alcoholism and substance abuse, providing community-based services for indemnification, motivation, counselling, de-addiction, aftercare, and rehabilitation for whole-person recovery (WPR) of addicts
listings.Application Process: Online application submission, inspection and processing, grant disbursement in two installments, and execution of a continuity bond
listings.Tags: Alcoholism, Substance Abuse, Social Defence, Rehabilitation, Financial Assistance, Grant-in-Aid

listings.Scheme Name: Jeevanam Self-Employment Scheme To Dependents Of Crime Victims
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Dependents of crime victims, victims of crime with serious injuries
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a native and resident of Kerala State, the applicant must be either the person who has been seriously injured in a crime or must be a dependent - Wife/Husband/Unmarried son or daughter of the victim of the crime, the annual income of the family should not exceed ₹1,00,000/-, the applicant should have applied within 5 years of the crime
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial aid to dependents as well as victims of crime, financial assistance of ₹20,000/- will be provided as one-time assistance to the eligible beneficiary
listings.Application Process: Online application through SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal, registration and login required, fill in the application form and submit
listings.Tags: Crime Victims, Self-Employment, Financial Assistance, Kerala

listings.Scheme Name: Nari Niketans
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Welfare, Government of Jammu and Kashmir
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Deserted/destitute ladies/widows having no means of livelihood
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a citizen of India. 2. The applicant should be a domicile / permanent resident of the state of Jammu & Kashmir. 3. The applicant should be a Female. 4. The applicant should be deserted /destitute / widow. 5. The applicant should not have any means of livelihood.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides care and protection in the institutions. Besides food, shelter, bedding & clothing are also provided. For school-going destitute girls free education is provided in addition to other facilities.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Visit the District Social Welfare Office, and request a hard copy of the format of the application form for the scheme from the concerned authority. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach all the (self-attested) mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Social Welfare Officer. 4. Acquire the receipt/acknowledgment of the successful submission of the application form from the District Social Welfare Office.
listings.Tags: Rehabilitation, Shelter, Social Welfare, Widow, Destitute

listings.Scheme Name: Asangathit Karmakar Gambhir Bimari Chikitsa Sahayata Yojana
listings.Ministries/Departments: Labor Department of Chhattisgarh State
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Unorganized workers
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant must be registered with the State Board for at least 90 days. 2. The applicant must be between the ages of 18 and 60. 3. The applicant must be registered as a beneficiary of unorganized workers under Section 10 of the Act.
listings.Description & Benefits: Financial assistance will be provided for the medical treatment of serious illness like treatment of kidney, cancer, sickle cell anemia, heart disease, AIDS and paralysis. Unorganized workers can receive up to ₹ 50,000 in medical assistance.
listings.Application Process: Online application through the official website of Chhattisgarh Labour Department. Unregistered applicants need to register first and then apply for the scheme. Already registered applicants can directly apply for the scheme.
listings.Tags: Financial Assistance, Medical Treatment, Serious Illness, Unorganized Workers

listings.Scheme Name: Reimbursement of Stamp Duty and Registration Charges
listings.Ministries/Departments: Micro Small and Medium Enterprises Department, Government of Tamil Nadu
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Manufacturing enterprises (micro or small scale) set up in the declared backward blocks of the state of Tamil Nadu
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a manufacturing enterprise (micro or small scale), set up in the declared backward blocks of the state of Tamil Nadu. The incentive is admissible to eligible enterprises on the land area up to five times the plinth area of the factory building constructed.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to reduce the stamp duty and registration charges incurred by MSEs investing in backward blocks in Tamil Nadu. Eligible enterprises receive a 50% reimbursement of stamp duty and registration charges incurred on land purchases intended for industrial use.
listings.Application Process: Online application process involving registration, login, form filling, uploading documents, and submission. The applicant enterprises should apply for this incentive within 6 months from the date of commencement of commercial production.
listings.Tags: MSME, Reimbursement, Stamp Duty, Registration Charges, Tamil Nadu, Business, Enterprise

listings.Scheme Name: Support for Value Addition - Support to R&G units
listings.Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Commerce And Industry
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Individual units, Partnership firms, self-help groups (SHG)/ Growers’ collectives interested in establishing coffee roasting units
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicants should be individual units, Partnership firms, self-help groups (SHG)/ Growers’ collectives interested in establishing coffee roasting units. The Scheme is applicable only for the establishment of new R&G units. The applicant’s unit must hold a valid business license from the respective statutory authorities.
listings.Description & Benefits: This scheme aims to enhance the quality of coffee products and achieve value addition through the introduction of improved technologies in roasting, grinding, and packaging which will result in boosting domestic coffee consumption and entrepreneurship in the coffee sector, especially in the non-traditional areas. Benefits include subsidy support of 40% of the machinery cost with a ceiling of ₹10,00,000 for roasting units, and 50% subsidy support for SHGs, women entrepreneurs, SC/ ST, Minorities, and differently-abled beneficiaries.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of application form with mandatory documents at the Coffee Board office. Post-application processes include scrutiny, feasibility assessment, procurement, installation, and commissioning of R&G machinery, and submission of support claim application.
listings.Tags: Agriculture, Direct Benefit Transfer, Farmer, Financial Assistance, Subsidy

listings.Scheme Name: MANAGE Internship Programme
listings.Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Students from the disciplines of Extension Education, Economics, Sociology, Psychology, MSW, Journalism, Communication, and Environmental Science
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Completed/ongoing PhD or M.Sc in Extension Education/ Economics/ Sociology/ Psychology/ MSW/ Journalism/ Communication/ Environmental Science, OGPA of a minimum of 8 out of 10 (minimum 80%), fluency in English, good writing skills
listings.Description & Benefits: Capacity development in research and extension, stipend of ₹10,000 per month for a 3-month internship or ₹35,000 per month for a 6-month internship
listings.Application Process: Email CV, motivation letter, and recommendation letter from the Head of the Department/Chairman of the advisory committee to saravananraj.manage@gmail.com
listings.Tags: Agriculture, Environment, Internship, Management, Student

listings.Scheme Name: Laadli Laxmi Scheme
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Women & Child Development, Government of Goa
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Girl child
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a Girl, born in the State of Goa OR should be a resident of Goa for the last fifteen years, parental income of the applicant does not exceed ₹ 3,00,000 per annum, and the applicant should qualify for ANY ONE of the following three criteria: a) At least one of the parents of the applicant is born in Goa and is also a resident of Goa for the last fifteen years, b) One of the parents of the applicant is residing in Goa for the last twenty-five years, c) In case the applicant is an affected person of Tillari Irrigation Project (a joint venture of the Government of Goa and the government of Maharashtra) and was rehabilitated in the State of Goa
listings.Description & Benefits: Financial Assistance of ₹ 1,00,000, by means of a bank fixed deposit, jointly in the name of the Director (DoWCD) and the applicant, to financially empower the girl child to meet educational and other expenses on becoming a major of age and to improve the female sex ratio in the State
listings.Application Process: Offline, application form can be obtained from designated Offices notified by the Director of Women and Child Development or designated bank branches, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest if required), and send the application to: Director, Directorate of Women And Child Development, Panaji-Goa, 2nd floor, Old Education Building, 18th June Road, Altinho, Panaji, Goa - 403 001
listings.Tags: Financial Assistance, Girl Child, Marriage, Social Welfare

listings.Scheme Name: Distress Relief Fund For The Differently Abled (Medical Treatment)
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Differently Abled persons
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native and resident of Kerala State. 2. The disabled person or who has become handicapped due to an accident is eligible to apply under the scheme for their medical treatment, including surgery. 3. Those differently-abled persons whose annual income does not exceed (₹20,000/- in Rural areas and ₹22,375/- in Urban areas) shall be eligible for financial assistance. 4. Physically handicapped persons shall include the following disabilities/categories: a. Blind b. Deaf and Dumb c. Orthopedically Handicapped d. Mentally Challenged e. Persons in the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category having 40 % disability or more.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹5,000/- per person in a year for medical treatment, including surgery, to differently abled persons.
listings.Application Process: Online application through SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal
listings.Tags: BPL, Differently Abled, Distress, Financial Assistance, Handicap, Medical Treatment, PwD

listings.Scheme Name: Coaching Schemes For Sc/st/obc (non-creamy Layer) & Minority Students For Universities
listings.Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Minority Affairs
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Students belonging to SC (Scheduled Caste), ST (Scheduled Tribe), OBC (Other Backward Classes) (non-creamy layer), and minority communities
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Financial assistance under the scheme is available to such universities and colleges which come within the purview of Section 2(f) and are fit to receive central assistance under Section 12(B) of the UGC Act, 1956. Institutions having a sufficient number of Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and Minority Communities students will be considered for financial assistance. General candidates holding BPL Cards (Below Poverty Line) issued by the Central Government /State Government may also be allowed for such coaching classes.
listings.Description & Benefits: Coaching schemes for students belonging to SC (Scheduled Caste), ST (Scheduled Tribe), OBC (Other Backward Classes) (non-creamy layer), and minority communities are implemented to provide them with equal opportunities and support in pursuing higher education. These schemes aim to bridge the educational gap and enhance the competitiveness of these students.
listings.Application Process: Offline. The applicant needs to contact the Registrar/Principal, fill out the application form, and submit it to the concerned department.
listings.Tags: Coaching, Education, Minority, SC, ST, OBC, University

listings.Scheme Name: Atma Nirbhar Bagwani Yojana
listings.Ministries/Departments: Government of Arunachal Pradesh
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Farmers of Arunachal Pradesh
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Residents and farmers of Arunachal Pradesh
listings.Description & Benefits: Umbrella scheme providing 45% subsidy, 45% bank finance, and 10% beneficiaries contribution for the cultivation of fruits like apples, walnut, orange, kiwi, and persimmon.
listings.Application Process: Offline
listings.Tags: Subsidy, Umbrella Scheme, Farmers, Arunachal Pradesh, Horticulture

listings.Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Nischay Swayam Sahayata Bhatta Yojna
listings.Ministries/Departments: Government of Bihar
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Educated unemployed citizens of Bihar State
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. Age group of 20 to 25 years, 2. Unemployed young men/women who are not studying and are looking for employment, 3. Educational qualification is inter (12th) passed from a government-recognized institution located in the state but have not received higher education, 4. Permanent resident of the district of Bihar state, 5. Not received any kind of allowance/scholarship/student credit card/education loan or any kind of assistance from any other source, 6. Not get any type of government or non-government employment (contract/permanent/ temporary), 7. Not self-employed
listings.Description & Benefits: Financial assistance to educated unemployed citizens to help them overcome financial difficulties, The amount of self-help allowance will be paid to the eligible applicant at the rate of Rs.1000 per month for a maximum period of two years
listings.Application Process: Online application through official website, Registration, Authentication through OTP, Filling of application form, Submission
listings.Tags: Financial Assistance, Skilled Youth Program, Social Welfare, Unemployment

listings.Scheme Name: Natural Calamity Relief to Fishermen of State
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Active fishermen who contribute to the Fishermen Corpus Relief Fund
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a Fisherman, should have been contributing to the Fishermen Corpus Relief Fund, should have a registered non-motorized/motorized canoe and mechanized fishing vessel/trawler with the Department of Fisheries, should not be a defaulter of the department, and the loss or damage should be verified by the competent authority.
listings.Description & Benefits: Financial assistance is provided to active fishermen whose fishing vessels are damaged or lost due to natural calamities. The benefits include financial assistance for death/disability, loss/damage to fishing canoe, loss/damage to fishing vessel, and loss/damage to fishing nets.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process. The applicant needs to take a print of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. The application form should be submitted to the concerned authority at the Department of Fisheries or to the official posted at the BDO Office/Sub-Offices of the Department of Fisheries.
listings.Tags: Crisis, Disaster, Financial Assistance, Fishermen, Relief

listings.Scheme Name: Industry Linked Biotechnology Research Scheme (IBRS)
listings.Ministries/Departments: Kerala Biotechnology Commission (KBC) under the Kerala State Council for Science, Technology and Environment (KSCSTE)
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Scientists and Technologists of R&D Centers/academic Institutions/Organizations actively involved in biotechnological research
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Applicants should be Scientists and Technologists of R&D Centers/Academic Institutions/Organizations actively involved in biotechnological research with emphasis on areas relating to marine, agriculture, health, and environment. Proposals need to be submitted in active collaboration with an industry in which the industrial partner is willing to share 25% of the Kerala Biotechnology Commission allocated funds additionally.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance in the form of grants to facilitate Academia-Industry interaction by undertaking projects in collaboration with an industrial partner which should result in commercializing the product or process or service. The grant amount is ₹40 lakhs excluding overhead cost and industry share (25%) for a period of three years.
listings.Application Process: Applications are invited through advertisement and the project proposal should be submitted online. The application process involves endorsement from the Head of Institution, evaluation by referees, and final decision by the expert committee.
listings.Tags: Biotechnology, Grant, Industry, Research, Scientist, Technologist

listings.Scheme Name: Financial Assistance for the Purchase of Lifejackets and Lifebuoys for Fishermen
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Traditional fishermen by birth or profession, residents of Goa
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a traditional fisherman by birth or profession, a resident of Goa, and possess one of the following: a Canoe Fitted With OBM; Mechanised Trawlers Engaged in Trawling or Purse Seining Operations.
listings.Description & Benefits: Financial assistance amounting to ₹50% is provided by the Government to eligible fishermen for the Purchase of Lifejackets and Lifebuoys. The support is extended up to ₹1,000/- per lifejacket and ₹1,500/- per lifebuoy.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process. The interested applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the concerned authority at the Department of Fisheries or its designated offices.
listings.Tags: Fishermen, Lifejackets, Lifebuoys, Financial Assistance, Goa

listings.Scheme Name: Coffee Development Programme in North Eastern Region: Quality Upgradation / Certification: Support for Eco-Certification / Organic Certification
listings.Ministries/Departments: Ministry of Commerce and Industry
listings.Target Beneficiaries: SHGs/collectives of tribal growers, small growers
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicants should be SHGs/collectives of tribal growers who obtain certification of their plantations for various sustainability and quality standards.
listings.Description & Benefits: This scheme aims to encourage coffee growers to improve quality for higher returns and improve access to high-value specialty markets through the production of eco-certified coffees.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process involving certification completion, documentation, submission to Coffee Board Office, review, and verification.
listings.Tags: Agriculture, DBT, Farmer, Subsidy

listings.Scheme Name: NSAP - Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme
listings.Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Rural Development
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Citizens living Below Poverty Line and 60 years or above in age
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a citizen of India, living Below Poverty Line, and at least 60 years of age.
listings.Description & Benefits: A monthly pension of ₹ 200 up to 79 years and ₹ 500 thereafter. The scheme provides social assistance benefits to poor households in the case of old age of the breadwinner.
listings.Application Process: Online application through UMANG App or website. Fill basic details, choose the mode of payment of pension, upload photo and click on “Submit”.
listings.Tags: BPL, Pension, Senior Citizen, Social Welfare

listings.Scheme Name: Shram Kalyan Shaikshanik Chatravriti Yojana
listings.Ministries/Departments: Madhya Pradesh State Government
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Children of labourers
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Madhya Pradesh. 2. The parents of the applicant should be employed in a factory or institution established in Madhya Pradesh under the Labor Welfare Fund Act, 1982. 3. Only 2 children of a family are eligible to get the benefits of this scheme. 4. Children of officers and employees working in institutions with managerial capacity are not eligible to get the benefit of this scheme.
listings.Description & Benefits: The main objective of the Madhya Pradesh Shram Kalyan Academic Scholarship Scheme is to provide scholarships to the children of labourers to get an education. Through this scheme, scholarships will be provided from the 5th class to a higher level of education.
listings.Application Process: 1. Applicants have to visit the official scholarship portal of the Student Labor Welfare Board. 2. Fill out the entries of the academic scholarship application form online. 3. The applicant will have to authenticate his identity by giving his own and his mother's / father's Aadhaar numbers. 4. Online applications for academic scholarships will have to be made within the time limit. Applications received after the prescribed period will not be considered by the Board and no action will be taken. 5. Upload the required documents. 6. Submit.
listings.Tags: Financial Assistance, Higher Education, Student Finance

listings.Scheme Name: Jai Johar (Old Age Pension) Scheme
listings.Ministries/Departments: Tribal Development Department, Government of West Bengal
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Tribe (ST) residents of West Bengal of the age of 60 years and above
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. Permanent resident of West Bengal, 2. Belong to Scheduled Tribe (ST) category, 3. Attained the age of 60 years or more, 4. Not a beneficiary under any other Social Security pension scheme, 5. Not a recipient of Government pension or pension from any other organization
listings.Description & Benefits: A monthly pension of ₹1,000/- is transferred directly to the individual bank account of the beneficiary
listings.Application Process: Offline application through Block Development Officer (BDO) / Sub Divisional Officer (SDO) / Kolkata Municipal Corporation
listings.Tags: Financial Assistance, Pension, Scheduled Tribe, Senior Citizen, Social Welfare

listings.Scheme Name: Innovation In Science Pursuit For Inspired Research (INSPIRE) - Faculty Fellowship
listings.Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Science And Technology
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Young researchers with Ph.D. qualifications in the age group of 27-32 years
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Indian citizens and People of Indian origin with PIO status having Ph.D. degrees in science, mathematics, engineering, pharmacy, medicine, and agriculture-related subjects; minimum 60% marks throughout academic profile; upper age limit of 32 years for General Category, 37 years for SC, ST, and Women candidates, and 42 years for persons with benchmark disabilities
listings.Description & Benefits: Provides opportunities to 100 persons every year to carry out research in basic and applied science areas for 5 years; grants an attractive fellowship for a duration of 5 years; objective is to encourage young researchers to continue research in areas of S&T, Medicine, Agriculture, Pharmacy, and Veterinary Sciences
listings.Application Process: Online application through the INSPIRE program portal; three-tier selection process involving evaluation by discipline-based Expert Committees, recommendations of the Apex Level Committee and INSPIRE Faculty Award Council, and final selection by DST
listings.Tags: Faculty Fellowship, Research, Science, Technology, Medicine, Agriculture, Pharmacy, Veterinary Sciences

listings.Scheme Name: Subsidy for the Purchase of Fiber-reinforced Plastic Cattamaran/ Vallam/ Wooden Nava/ Marine Plywood Canoe With Nets
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare, Government of Puducherry
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Fishermen community, Fish traders, Prospective entrepreneurs
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Belong to fishermen community or professionally engaged in fishing/fish trade occupation, Resided in Puducherry for at least 5 years, Member of Fishermen Co-operative Society, Age between 23 and 60 years, Not a recipient of Old Age Pension, Not employed in Government/Government Undertakings/Fishermen Co-operative Society, No outstanding dues to Department/Fishermen Co-operative Societies
listings.Description & Benefits: Subsidy for the procurement of fiber-reinforced plastic vallam with nets to increase marine fish production
listings.Application Process: Offline, Submit application form with required documents to the concerned authority
listings.Tags: Fisheries, Subsidy, Marine Fisheries, Puducherry

listings.Scheme Name: Goa Village & Municipal Child Committee Grants And Awards Scheme (GVMCCGS)
listings.Ministries/Departments: Directorate of Women And Child Development
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Village and Municipal Child Committees
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be the concerned local body i.e. a Panchayat or a Municipal local body. The applicant should have established a Village or Municipal Child Committee as prescribed under Rule 7 of The Goa Children's Homes Rules, 2004. The Committee should have met at least once in the last three months prior to submission of the application. The Committee should have met to discuss and resolve the issues relating to children within the jurisdiction of the local body. The concerned local body should have provided the space for facilitating sittings of the Committee in its premises as and when required.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides an annual financial grant of ₹ 10,000/- towards administrative expenses incurred on organizing the activities of the Committee.
listings.Application Process: The application as per the prescribed format, along with the supporting documents showing the activities of the Child Committee of the Local Body, shall be addressed/submitted directly to: The Director, Directorate of Women And Child Development, Panaji-Goa, 2nd floor, Old Education Building, 18th June Road, Altinho, Panaji, Goa - 403 001.
listings.Tags: Child Rights, Municipal, Panchayat, Village, Award, Grant

listings.Scheme Name: Junior Research Fellowship
listings.Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Science And Technology
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Indian nationals pursuing doctoral research in biotechnology and life sciences
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. Applicant must be an Indian citizen. 2. Applicant must have a master's degree in biotechnology or a related field from a recognized university. 3. Applicant must clear the GAT or NET exam in biotechnology or a related field. 4. Applicant should not be more than 28 years for general and EWS category candidates and 33 years for SC/ST/PH category candidates.
listings.Description & Benefits: The Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) from the Department of Biotechnology (DBT) is a fellowship program that provides financial support to students who are pursuing doctoral research in biotechnology and life sciences. The fellowship amount for the JRF program is ₹31,000 per month for the first two years and ₹35,000 per month for the remaining three years.
listings.Application Process: The application process involves four steps: 1. Qualify in the Biotechnology Eligibility Test (BET), 2. Apply for the DBT-JRF program online, 3. Appear for the interview, and 4. Check the final selection list.
listings.Tags: Biotechnology, Life Sciences, Research, Fellowship, Financial Assistance

listings.Scheme Name: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme - Sikkim
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Women & Child Welfare, Govt. of Sikkim
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Elderly citizens above the age of 60 years belonging to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a resident of the state of Sikkim, from Below Poverty Line (BPL) family, attained the age of 60 years and above, have no source of income, not be a recipient of salary/pension/family pension from Central Government / other State Governments, and have opened a Bank Account under “Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana”.
listings.Description & Benefits: A pension is provided to elderly citizens above the age of 60 years belonging to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category and the beneficiary will receive a monthly pension of ₹ 1500/-, ₹ 2000/- & ₹ 2500/- as per eligibility criteria.
listings.Application Process: Offline and Online application process. The applicant has to approach their concerned Gram Panchayat /Municipality / Municipal Corporation office, fill in the application form, attach mandatory documents and submit it to the designated receiving authority.
listings.Tags: Old Age, Pension, Below Poverty Line, Direct Benefit Transfer

listings.Scheme Name: ASEAN-India Research Training Fellowship (AI-RTF)
listings.Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Science And Technology
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Young talented researchers/scientists of ASEAN member countries
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Applicant must be holding the nationality of any of the ASEAN Member Countries, possess at least a Master’s Degree in any Natural Sciences or an equivalent degree in Technology/Engineering/Medicine / allied disciplines, be working/studying and/or affiliated with any national R&D or academic institution in his/her home ASEAN Member Country, and be below 45 years of age as of the date of submission of the application.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme is launched as an initiative under the ASEAN-India Science & Technology Development Fund (AISTDF) to support young talented researchers/scientists of ASEAN member countries to carry out research at any of the Indian research/academic Institution. The fellowship provides full financial assistance, including round trip international airfare, visa fees, overseas medical insurance, consolidated Fellowship amount of Indian Rupees (INR) 60,000/- per month, one-time grant of INR 40,000/- as research contingency expenses, and institutional overhead charges.
listings.Application Process: The applications are to be submitted only ONLINE at [www.aistic.gov.in](http://www.aistic.gov.in). The hard copies of the application are not required.
listings.Tags: ASEAN, Fellowship, Research, Science, Technology, Innovation

listings.Scheme Name: Promotion of Energy Audit and Conservation of Energy (PEACE): Incentive for Implementing Energy Audit Recommendations
listings.Ministries/Departments: Micro Small and Medium Enterprises Department, Government of Tamil Nadu
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Manufacturing MSMEs in the state of Tamil Nadu
listings.Eligibility Criteria: MSMEs that have undertaken energy audits and achieved at least 10% energy savings in terms of the number of units of energy consumed per unit of product manufactured with reference to the last 12 months average.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides an incentive of 50% of the cost of eligible components, subject to a maximum limit of ₹ 10,00,000/-, to MSMEs that implement the recommendations of the Energy Audit Report and optimize energy consumption leading to energy saving and money savings in electricity bills.
listings.Application Process: Online application through the official website/portal of the Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises Department of the Government of Tamil Nadu, involving registration, login, form filling, document upload, and submission.
listings.Tags: Energy Audit, Energy Conservation, MSME, Tamil Nadu, Incentive, Subsidy

listings.Scheme Name: Scholarships to Students with Disabilities Scheme
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Social Security and Women & Child Development, Government of Punjab
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Students with disabilities
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. Students of Punjab having 40% and above disability certificate. 2. Monthly income of family/guardians should not exceed ₹5,000/- per month. 3. Candidate should have secured at least 40% marks in the previous annual examination.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme assists students with disabilities to secure education, academic, technical, or professional training to enable them to earn a living and become useful members of society. The scheme provides a scholarship of ₹200/- per month per student with a disability for education from class 1st to 8th and ₹300/- per month per student with a disability for education/training from 9th class onwards.
listings.Application Process: Offline application is submitted to the Head of school/college/ institution who after verifying it shall forward it to the District Social Security Officer (DSSO) of the concerned district.
listings.Tags: Disability, PwD, Scholarship, Student, Education, Training

listings.Scheme Name: Grant of Financial Assistance for Performance of Marriage of Poor Brides Living Below Poverty Line
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Puducherry
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Poor brides living below the poverty line
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The annual income of the applicant should not exceed ₹75,000 per annum. The parents/guardian of the bride should be a citizen of India and a native of the Union Territory of Pondicherry by birth or by continuous residence of 5 years or more. The assistance is payable only for the first marriage of the bride. The marriage should be performed in accordance with the law in force on the date of marriage. The assistance is given for the performance of the marriage of one daughter only. The bride should have attained the age of 18 years, and the bridegroom 21 years on the date of marriage.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to poor brides living below the poverty line to meet their marriage expenses. The assistance amount is ₹25,000, and it is granted for the first marriage of the bride.
listings.Application Process: Offline: Visit the Office/ Sub-Office of the Department of Women and Child Development, request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Deputy Director (Women Development) or the Child Development Project Officer at least 30 days before the proposed marriage date.
listings.Tags: Financial Assistance, Marriage, Poverty Line, Women Empowerment

listings.Scheme Name: Intensive Castration Scheme
listings.Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Livestock owners and animal-rearing organizations
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be an individual livestock owner or an animal-rearing organization (Gaushala/Panjarapol/others). The male calf must be castrated through the close or open method.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides a subsidy of ₹500/- per male calf for castration through the closed method (Burdizo Castrator) or open method (Surgical Method).
listings.Application Process: Online application through I-Khedut Portal, followed by submission of required documents to the concerned Taluka office.
listings.Tags: Animal Husbandry, Cow, Low Genetic Animal, Castration, Livestock, Gujarat

listings.Scheme Name: Scheme for Assistance to MSMEs for Market Development
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Industries and Commerce, Government of Rajasthan
listings.Target Beneficiaries: MSMEs registered in Rajasthan
listings.Eligibility Criteria: MSMEs existing anywhere in Rajasthan with Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) as per MSME Development Act 2006
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to promote and financially support the participation of MSMEs in national and international trade fairs, exhibitions, and buyer-seller meets, etc.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process through submission of application form and documents to the concerned General Manager, District Industries & Commerce Centre (DICC)
listings.Tags: MSME, Market Development, International Exhibition, National Exhibition, Rajasthan MSME Policy 2024

listings.Scheme Name: Providing Navigational Aids and Other Infrastructure Facilities
listings.Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Fishermen
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be a native of Gujarat, own a registered fishing boat under Real Craft software, possess a valid fishing license, have a bank account in their name, and have obtained in-principle approval to purchase of the floor plan.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance for purchasing essential fishing equipment, life-saving gear, and infrastructure to enhance safety, efficiency, and fish preservation. It also provides financial aid to families of fishermen captured in Pakistan and subsidies for setting up ice plants, cold storage, and fish processing units.
listings.Application Process: Online application through i-Khedut Portal
listings.Tags: Agriculture, Fishing, Infrastructure, Gujarat

listings.Scheme Name: Merit Scholarship to SC/ST/OBC/Minority students studying in recognised Colleges/Professional/Technical Institutions
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of SC/ST/OBC, Government of NCT of Delhi
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Students from marginalized communities (SC/ST/OBC/Minority) pursuing higher education in recognized institutions
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Resident of Delhi, belongs to SC/ST/OBC/Minority category, enrolled in a recognized school/college/institution in India, student, secured 60% or above marks in the previous examination, family income limit of ₹2,00,000/- per annum for OBC and Minority students
listings.Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance to students from marginalized communities pursuing higher education in recognized institutions, offers monthly scholarships to hostellers and day scholars based on their course of study, with amounts ranging from ₹420/- to ₹1,860/- per month
listings.Application Process: Online application through e-District Portal of the Govt. of NCT of Delhi, registration and login required, fill in the application form, upload mandatory documents, and submit
listings.Tags: Scholarship, SC/ST/OBC/Minority, Higher Education, Financial Assistance

listings.Scheme Name: Assistance to OBM Boat Owner Fishermen on Purchase of Kerosene
listings.Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Fishermen owning small boats with Outboard Motors (OBM)
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat, own a small boat operated by an Outboard Motor (OBM), and possess a government-issued Kerosene/Petrol Card.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹50/- per liter of kerosene or petrol to eligible fishermen to help reduce their fuel expenses.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process: Purchase kerosene or petrol from government-approved fuel stations, collect original bills, and submit an application along with required documents to the concerned district office.
listings.Tags: Fishermen, Fishing Activities, Kerosene, Petrol, Gujarat, Agriculture

listings.Scheme Name: Subsidy Scheme on Establishment of 25 R.I.R. Bird’s unit 40 R.I.R. Bird’s Unit and Stipend for Poultry Farming Training
listings.Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Economically Weaker Section(EWS), Divyang individuals
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Applicant must be from Gujarat, belong to Economically Weaker Section(EWS), have taken 6 days of poultry-rearing training
listings.Description & Benefits: Provides financial support in kind (poultry birds and feed) to eligible beneficiaries, financial aid as a stipend to those undergoing poultry farming training
listings.Application Process: Online application through iKhedut Portal
listings.Tags: Poultry Farming, Agriculture, Gujarat, Weaker Sections, Divyang Individuals

listings.Scheme Name: Bhed Palan Yojana
listings.Ministries/Departments: Animal Husbandry Department, Government of Uttarakhand
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. Permanent resident of Uttarakhand, 2. Belong to Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe category, 3. Listed in SECC (Socio-Economic Caste Census) database, 4. Interested in establishing a sheep-rearing unit for self-employment
listings.Description & Benefits: Financial assistance is provided by the State Government to eligible beneficiaries for purchasing sheep to establish a sheep-rearing unit comprising 10 female sheep and 1 male sheep, for a duration of 10 to 14 months. The scheme encourages the improvement of economic conditions of Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes by providing them with sustainable livelihood opportunities in animal husbandry.
listings.Application Process: Offline and Online. Step 1: Present proposal during the open meeting of the Gram Sabha. Step 2: Submit proposal with required documents to the Veterinary Officer, Livestock Extension Officer, or Gram Panchayat Development Officer. Step 3: Proposal is reviewed and recommended by the village-level selection committee. Step 4: Financial assistance is disbursed to the beneficiary through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) within one to two months.
listings.Tags: Self-employment, Sheep, Sheep Rearing, Subsidy

listings.Scheme Name: Gau Palan Yojana
listings.Ministries/Departments: Animal Husbandry Department, Government of Uttarakhand
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Castes or Scheduled Tribes under the SECC category
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. Permanent resident of Uttarakhand, 2. Belong to Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe category, 3. Listed in the SECC (Socio-Economic Caste Census) database
listings.Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance for purchasing a milch cow up to the fourth calving, with a total assistance of ₹36,000 and a beneficiary contribution of ₹4,000
listings.Application Process: Offline and Online, involving proposal submission to Gram Sabha, review by village-level selection committee, and final selection by development block-level committee
listings.Tags: Cow Rearing, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribes, Self-employment, Subsidy

listings.Scheme Name: Mahila Bakri Palan
listings.Ministries/Departments: Animal Husbandry Department, Government of Uttarakhand
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Abandoned, widowed, destitute, single, and disaster-affected women
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a woman. 2. The applicant should be interested in goat rearing. 3. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. 4. The applicant should be from one of the following categories: Widow, Abandoned, Destitute, Living alone, Disaster-affected
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to promote livelihood and self-reliance among women through goat rearing. Financial assistance of up to ₹35,000/- is provided by the State Government to eligible beneficiaries for the purchase of one unit of goats (comprising 3 females and 1 male), aged between 12 to 18 months.
listings.Application Process: Offline and Online. Step 1: Present proposal during the open meeting of the Gram Sabha. Step 2: Submit the proposal, along with all the required documents, to the Veterinary Officer, Livestock Extension Officer, or Gram Panchayat Development Officer of the concerned area. Step 3: The proposal is reviewed and recommended by the village-level selection committee. After recommendation, the development block-level committee conducts the final selection and forwards it to the Animal Husbandry Department.
listings.Tags: Goat Rearing, Financial Support, Women Empowerment, Livestock Development

listings.Scheme Name: Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (General Category)
listings.Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Livestock owners belonging to the General Category
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant must be a livestock owner. 2. The applicant must belong to the General Category. 3. The animal must have recently calved (given birth).
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides 150 kg of BIS Type II concentrate feed free of cost to livestock owners during the critical post-parturition period, one month after delivery, to support the health of the mother cattle and the calf.
listings.Application Process: Online application through I-Khedut Portal, with 8 steps: 1. Visit the portal, 2. Click on 'Schemes' and then 'Animal Husbandry Schemes', 3. Select the scheme and click 'Apply', 4. Submit a new application, 5. Click 'Update Application' to add corrections, 6. Confirm the application, 7. Take a printout of the confirmed application, 8. Check application status/view/print/upload application details.
listings.Tags: Animal Husbandry, Cattle Development, Concentrate Feeds, Milk Production

listings.Scheme Name: Maternity Benefit Scheme (HBOCWWB)
listings.Ministries/Departments: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Women registered construction workers
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The women worker should be registered under Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB) and have a minimum of one-year regular membership.
listings.Description & Benefits: Financial assistance of ₹36,000/- (i.e. ₹30,000/- for motherhood and ₹6000/- for nutritious food) will be given to women registered construction workers after the birth of the child.
listings.Application Process: Online application through Antyodaya-SARAL Portal
listings.Tags: Maternity, Financial Assistance, Construction Workers, Women, Haryana

listings.Scheme Name: Assistance for Digitization of Business Processes and Adoption of eCommerce
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Industries and Commerce, Government of Rajasthan
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) in production
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The enterprise should be a Micro, Small, or Medium Enterprise (MSME) in production. 2. The enterprise should be located in Rajasthan. 3. The applicant should possess a valid Udyam Registration Certificate at the time of application. 4. The applicant should have incurred expenses on digitization (software/equipment) after notification of Rajasthan MSME Policy 2024. 5. The applicant should have registered on an eCommerce platform after the notification of Rajasthan MSME Policy 2024.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to promote digital transformation and enhance the eCommerce capabilities of MSMEs in the state. Financial assistance is provided for adopting software, equipment for digitization, and for registering on eCommerce platforms.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Download the application form from the official website. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the respective General Manager, District Industries & Commerce Centre (DICC).
listings.Tags: Digitization Of Business, eCommerce, Financial Assistance, MSME, MSME Policy

listings.Scheme Name: Samman Bhatta to War Widows and Parents of Martyrs
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Sainik Welfare, Government of Rajasthan
listings.Target Beneficiaries: War widows and parents of unmarried martyrs
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan. The applicant should either be a war widow of a martyr or a parent of an unmarried martyr who sacrificed their life in wars, counter-insurgency operations, or aid to civil authorities before 31st March 1999.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide lifelong financial assistance to war widows and parents of unmarried martyrs who sacrificed their lives in various wars, counter-insurgency operations, and aid to civil authorities before 31st March 1999. The amount is deposited directly into the beneficiary’s bank account every month. Samman Bhatta is provided at ₹5000/- per month for a lifetime.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process. The interested applicant should visit the office of the District Sainik Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. OR The applicant should download the application form from the official website.
listings.Tags: Financial Assistance, Martyrs, War Widows, Parents of Martyrs, Rajasthan

listings.Scheme Name: Jan-Nayak Karpoori Thakur Kalyan Hostel Scheme
listings.Ministries/Departments: BC & EBC Welfare Department, Government of Bihar
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Backward Classes and Extremely Backward Classes students
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. Permanent resident of Bihar, 2. Studying in an educational institution near the hostel, 3. Belong to the Extremely Backward Class (EBC), 4. Studying in Class 10+2 or higher
listings.Description & Benefits: Provides residential facilities to students, 9 kg of rice and 6 kg of wheat per month, and ₹1000/- per month under the Chief Minister's Hostel Grant Scheme
listings.Application Process: Offline, Collect and submit the prescribed application form to the District Backward & Extremely Backward Class Welfare Office, Saharsa
listings.Tags: Education, Hostel, Student, Backward Classes, Extremely Backward Classes, Bihar

listings.Scheme Name: Post Matric Scholarship for SC students (Delhi)
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department for the Welfare of SC/ST/OBC, Government of NCT of Delhi
listings.Target Beneficiaries: SC students pursuing post-matriculation or post-secondary education in recognized institutions within India
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Annual family income limit of ₹2,50,000/- and enrollment in a recognized institution
listings.Description & Benefits: Financial assistance to SC students, covering maintenance allowance, tuition fees, and additional allowances for specific needs
listings.Application Process: Online application through e-District Portal of the Govt. of NCT of Delhi
listings.Tags: Education, Scheduled Caste, Scholarship, Student

listings.Scheme Name: World War II Pension
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Sainik Welfare, Government of Rajasthan
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Ex-servicemen who served in World War II and their widows
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan. 2. The applicant should be either an ex-serviceman who served during World War II (1st September 1939 to 15th August 1945) or his widow. 3. The applicant should not be receiving any pension or financial assistance from any other source.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides lifelong financial assistance as a measure of relief to World War II ex-servicemen and their widows who are not receiving any pension or financial assistance from any other source. Eligible beneficiaries receive ₹15,000/- per month, which is directly deposited into their bank accounts every month.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Visit the office of the District Sainik Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Sainik Welfare Office.
listings.Tags: Pension, Ex-servicemen, Widows, World War II, Financial Assistance, Rajasthan

listings.Scheme Name: To Increase Fish Seed Production and Inland Fisheries Equipment in Non-Tribal Areas
listings.Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Individuals, societies, self-help groups, associations, reservoir monopolies, private units involved in inland fisheries activities
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Applicant should be a Fisherman, above 18 years of age, have own private land/leased land, and a bank account
listings.Description & Benefits: Provides financial assistance for fish farming, fish seed rearing, and procurement of essential fisheries equipment, benefiting individuals, societies, and self-help groups involved in inland fisheries
listings.Application Process: Online application through I-Khedut Portal, with 8 steps: register, select scheme, apply, submit, confirm, print, and track application status
listings.Tags: Fish Farming, Inland Fisheries, Fish Seed Production, Gujarat, Agriculture, Farmer

listings.Scheme Name: Fishermen Accident Relief Scheme
listings.Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Families of deceased fishermen in Gujarat
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant must be a legal heir of the deceased fisherman. The deceased must have been an active fisherman from Gujarat.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to the families of deceased fishermen in Gujarat in case of death in Pakistan Jail, lost in the sea, or accidental death while fishing at sea. The financial assistance varies based on the cause of death and is meant to help the legal heirs cope with the loss.
listings.Application Process: The legal heir of the deceased fisherman must collect and fill out the application form, submit it to the concerned district office along with necessary documents, and upon verification, financial assistance will be provided to the eligible beneficiary.
listings.Tags: Accidental Assistance, Agriculture, Farmer, Insurance

listings.Scheme Name: Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries
listings.Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Caste fishermen and fish farmers
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Individuals/societies/self-help groups/associations/reservoir monopolies/private units involved in inland fisheries activities can apply. The applicant should be a Fisherman, belong to the Schedule Caste (SC) category, be above 18 years of age, and have a valid bank account.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides assistance for fish seed rearing, stocking, and transportation, as well as financial aid for boats, nets, and fish sale equipment. Additionally, training programs with stipends are available to enhance skills and productivity in the fisheries sector.
listings.Application Process: Online application through the i-Khedut portal. The applicant must upload necessary documents and follow the steps to submit the application.
listings.Tags: Fisheries, Scheduled Caste, Gujarat, Agriculture, Fishermen, Fish Farmers

listings.Scheme Name: Central Assistance For One Time Settlement Of Displaced Families From PoK And Chhamb Under Prime Minister's Development Package
listings.Ministries/Departments: Ministry Of Home Affairs
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Displaced families from PoK And Chhamb and settled in the state of Jammu & Kashmir
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The Claimant/Head of the Displaced Persons family or his/her successor or heir residing within the State should be part of the overall category of 36,384 families belonging to any of the following categories: Pakistan occupied Jammu & Kashmir 1947 Displaced Persons, Chhamb 1965 and 1971 (camp/non-camp) Displaced Persons
listings.Description & Benefits: A relief and rehabilitation scheme providing central assistance to the displaced families from PoK And Chhamb and settled in the state of Jammu & Kashmir. This is an attempt to give every such child, an opportunity to study further and prepare for a successful future through education in AICTE Approved institutions and courses. ₹50,000.00 per annum for every year of study i.e. maximum 4 years duration for first-year admitted Degree students and maximum 3 years for Diploma Students as lump sum amount towards payment of college fee, purchase of computer, stationeries, books, equipment, software, etc.

listings.Scheme Name: Feed Based Fisheries Scheme
listings.Ministries/Departments: Agriculture, Animal Husbandry & Cooperation Department, Government of Jharkhand
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Fish Farmers
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a fisherman. 2. The applicant must be an active fish farmer involved in cage fish farming, Recirculatory Aquaculture Systems (RAS), or Biofloc systems. 3. The applicant should have at least one year of previous crop records. 4. The applicant should not be enrolled in other overlapping schemes for the same purpose.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to enhance fish production through feed-based fisheries. Financial support in the form of grants for floating fish feed is provided to fish farmers to increase fish production in various districts like Ranchi, Ramgarh, Koderma, Bokaro, Dhanbad, and Seraikela. Benefits include floating fish feed subsidy, support for cage fish farmers, and support for Biofloc pond farmers.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Visit the District Fisheries Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Fisheries Office. 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the District Fisheries Office.
listings.Tags: Fisheries, Fish Production, Financial Assistance, Grants, Fish Feed, Cage Fish Farming, Recirculatory Aquaculture Systems (RAS), Biofloc Systems

listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides monthly financial assistance of ₹2750 to eligible beneficiaries, The financial assistance will continue until the beneficiary turns 60 years old

listings.Scheme Name: Reimbursement of Tuition Fee and Transport Facility to Scheduled Castes Students Studying in Technical Institutions in Haryana
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Technical Education, Government of Haryana
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Castes students pursuing AICTE-approved technical courses in Haryana
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a Scheduled Caste student of Haryana. 2. The student should be enrolled in an AICTE-approved Diploma, Undergraduate, or Postgraduate technical course. 3. The applicant should be pursuing an AICTE-approved course in a government, private, or aided technical institution approved by the Technical Education Department, Haryana. 4. The applicant should be admitted through centralized counselling. 5. The applicant’s annual parental income should be between ₹2.5 lakh and ₹3.5 lakh for tuition fee reimbursement. 6. The applicant should not be residing in a campus hostel to be eligible for transport facility reimbursement.

listings.Scheme Name: Scheme for Assistance for Industrial Infrastructure

listings.Eligibility Criteria: Eligible institution means any Industries Association, Chamber of Commerce and industry or SPV of industries (which are registered under Societies Act, Trust Act or the Companies Act) or any Large Project/Group of Industries are eligible. listings.Scheme Name: INDIRAMMA Old Age Pension (Rural)
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Rural Development, Government of Andhra Pradesh
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Old age citizens, both male and female, who are 65 years of age or above and are destitute
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be from a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family, a local resident of the district, from a rural area, not covered under any other Pension Scheme, 65 years of age or above, destitute, with no means of subsistence, and no family or relatives to depend upon
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to disburse monthly pensions to old age citizens, both male and female, who are 65 years of age or above and are destitute. The pension amount is notified by the Government of Andhra Pradesh.
listings.Application Process: Offline, eligible citizens will be identified by their respective Gram Panchayat during the Gram Sabhas. listings.Scheme Name: Scheme for Enhancement of Technical Competence and Manpower: Scheme of Financial Assistance for Running Short-term Bridge Courses
listings.Ministries/Departments: Industries and Mines Department, Gujarat
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Industry Partners and Host Institutes
listings.Eligibility Criteria: Host Institute must be an ITIs, Polytechnic, Engineering College, or Government-Affiliated Institution with at least 5 years of experience. Industry Partner must be an industry/association with at least 10 years of experience in skill development. Both entities must be legally registered under Societies Act, Trust Act, or Companies Act. Courses should be aligned with NSDC, NCVT, GCVT, or Sector Skill Council guidelines. A minimum of 25% of course intake must be industry-sponsored. At least 75% of industry-sponsored trainees must be provided employment. The training center must be operational for at least 5 years.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to enhance skill development by providing industry-relevant training. It enables Industry Partners and Host Institutes to collaborate in setting up specialized training centers to equip trainees with in-demand skills, improving employability and workforce readiness. Financial assistance is provided for fixed cost, refurbishing support, and recurring cost. Additional assistance is provided for awareness programs, seminars, and other expenditures.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process. Submit the application form to The Centre for Entrepreneurship Development (CED) for onward submission to the Screening Committee. Applications are received twice a year in April and October.
listings.Tags: Entrepreneurship Development, Manpower Solution, Short Term Bridge Courses, Skill Development, Technical Competence

listings.Target Beneficiaries: Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) and their employees

listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide financial support to MSMEs for the skill upgradation of their workforce, bridge the industry’s skill gap, boost employment, and align workforce training with evolving technology and business needs. Benefits include financial assistance, skill enhancement, recognized training, and third-party assessment.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process involving submission of application form to The Centre for Entrepreneurship Development (CED) for onward submission to the Screening Committee.
listings.Tags: Entrepreneurship Development, Manpower Solution, MSME, Skill Development, Technical Competence

listings.Target Beneficiaries: Tribal communities managing Sarna, Jahersthan, Hadgadi, or Masna sites

Minimum marks required in the previous year's annual examination for fresh and renewal students.

listings.Scheme Name: Kailash Mansarovar Yatra- Madhya Pradesh
listings.Ministries/Departments: Religious Trusts and Endowments Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Pilgrims of Madhya Pradesh going on the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native of Madhya Pradesh. 2. The applicant must have completed the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra after being selected by the Ministry of External Affairs, Government of India. 3. Only individuals who have been selected by the Ministry of External Affairs, Government of India, for the pilgrimage are eligible for the benefits of this scheme. 4. The applicant should not be an income taxpayer. 5. Each individual is eligible for the grant only once in their lifetime.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to pilgrims of Madhya Pradesh who undertake the Kailash Mansarovar pilgrimage, reimbursing 50% of the total expenses incurred during the pilgrimage, up to a maximum of ₹30,000/- per pilgrim.

listings.Scheme Name: Mahila Nirman Shramik Vivah Yojana

listings.Target Beneficiaries: Registered female construction workers and maximum of two daughters of registered construction workers
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a female registered construction worker. 2. The female construction worker should have been registered for at least one year continuously. 3. The family of a registered construction worker can avail of this assistance only twice: however, there shall be only one claim in respect of a given marriage irrespective of the number of registered construction workers in the family. 4. The registered construction workers should not have any dues payable to the Board. 5. The registered construction worker's daughter should have attained the age prescribed by law for marriage for whose marriage the assistance is sought. 6. The registered construction worker's daughter should not be an employee in government or quasi-government.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to registered female construction workers and maximum of two daughters of registered construction workers for marriage purposes. A one-time grant of ₹50,000/- is provided to meet the marriage expenses.
