Step 3: Ensure that the CSC agent completes all mandatory fields in the application form and uploads copies of all required documents. Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted.
listings.Tags: Construction Workers, Female, Financial Assistance, Marriage

listings.Scheme Name: Mamata Scheme

listings.Application Process: Online and Offline applications are accepted. The beneficiary may download the MAMATA mobile Application or log in on the department portal to apply for the scheme.
listings.Tags: Maternity Benefit, Nutritional Support, Financial Assistance

listings.Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department, Government of Chhattisgarh
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Severely disabled (with a disability of 80% and above) and multi-disabled individuals aged 18 to 79 years who are living below the poverty line (BPL)
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a native of Chhattisgarh. 2. The applicant should be a person with multiple disabilities. 3. The applicant should have severe disabilities (with a disability percentage of 80% or above). 4. The applicant’s age should be between 18 and 79 years. 5. The applicant's name should be included in the list of families living Below Poverty Line. 6. The applicant should not be receiving pension benefits from any other Central or State Government pension scheme.
listings.Description & Benefits: Financial assistance is provided to support them in living a respectful life. Eligible beneficiaries will receive a monthly pension of ₹500/-, (Central contribution- ₹300/-, State Contribution- ₹200/-).

listings.Scheme Name: Shramashakthi Special Women's Scheme

listings.Target Beneficiaries: Widowed, divorced, unmarried women of the minority community
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a female. 2. The applicant should be a widowed, divorced, unmarried woman. 3. The applicant should belong to a religious minority community. 4. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Karnataka. 5. The applicant's age should be between 18 to 55 years. 6. The annual family income of the applicant from all sources should be below ₹3,50,000/-. 7. The applicant's family member should not be a State/Central Government employee. 8. The applicant or family members should not have availed of benefits under any other scheme (Excluding the Arivu Scheme) of the KMDCL in the last 5 years.

Click 'Proceed' and submit application.

listings.Scheme Name: Livelihood Support to Marine Fishermen during the Fishing Ban Period Scheme
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Fisheries & Animal Resources Development, Government of Odisha
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Marine fisher families
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The beneficiary must be an active Marine fisherman, in the age group of 18-70 years, a permanent resident of Odisha, and must possess identity and residential proof including an Aadhaar card. The beneficiary must be a boat owner (Motorized Boat)/ a crew member of a Motorized Boat / Fish trader/ engaged in sorting, and grading Fish, and other ancillary activities.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme supports the livelihood of marine fisher families in and around the turtle nesting and breeding areas of the state including round the year fishing ban in Bhitarkanika areas as no alternative is available. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹15,000/- annually to eligible beneficiaries.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process through the prescribed format devised by the Department to the Additional Fisheries Officer (Marine) of the district through the concerned Assistant Fisheries Officers (ME Unit).
listings.Tags: Fishermen, Livelihood, Odisha, Fishing Ban Period

listings.Scheme Name: Integrated Pest Management Demonstration Cum Training
listings.Ministries/Departments: Agriculture-Farmers Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Farmers
listings.Eligibility Criteria: For Farmer: The beneficiary should be a Farmer, a resident of Tamil Nadu, and willing to adopt Integrated Pest Management practices. For Farmer Field Schools: The entity/organization should be a Farmer Field School and interested in conducting a Demonstration and Training program for the Farmers.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme supports pest management practices through demonstrations and training in Farmer Field Schools. Financial assistance is granted for each 40-hectare demonstration and training cluster. The scheme aims to enhance pest control knowledge among farmers, helping them manage pests effectively while reducing reliance on chemical pesticides.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process: Collect the application form from the nearest Agricultural Office, fill out the form with required details and attach mandatory documents, and submit the form to the concerned office (Assistant Agricultural Officer at the Village Level, Agricultural Officer/Deputy Agricultural Officer at the Block Level, or the Joint Director of Agriculture at the District Level).
listings.Tags: Agriculture, Farmer, Integrated Pest Management, Training

listings.Scheme Name: Marriage Assistance (K.B.O.C.W.W.B)
listings.Ministries/Departments: Department of Labour, Karnataka
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Registered construction workers and their dependent children
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should be a registered construction worker under Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Karnataka with at least one (1) year before the marriage for which assistance is sought. Dependent children of the worker are also eligible for this assistance. The son or daughter must have reached the legal age for marriage i.e. 18 years for women and 21 years for men.
listings.Description & Benefits: Financial support of ₹60,000/- is provided to help with marriage expenses. The assistance can be claimed only once per marriage. A family can avail of this support twice in total.
listings.Application Process: Online application through the official website of Karnataka Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (KBOCWWB). The applicant needs to register as a construction worker, then login and apply for the scheme by filling in the mandatory details and uploading required documents.
listings.Tags: Marriage, Construction Worker, Labour, Welfare Scheme, Karnataka

listings.Description & Benefits: Provides subsidies for minikits to maize-growing farmers in selected districts to support agricultural productivity and enhance crop yields.

listings.Eligibility Criteria: The beneficiary should be a Farmer. The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu. The beneficiary should produce and supply Foundation or Certified seeds to the Department.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme is aimed at encouraging farmers to produce high-quality seeds. Under this initiative, farmers who produce and supply Foundation and Certified Class seeds to the Department of Agriculture are eligible to receive a subsidy of ₹1,000/- per quintal.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process. Collect the application form from the nearest Agricultural Office, fill out the form with required details and attach mandatory documents, and submit the form to the concerned office (Village Level: Assistant Agricultural Officer, Block Level: Agricultural Officer or Deputy Agricultural Officer, District Level: Joint Director of Agriculture).

listings.Eligibility Criteria: The worker should be engaged in building or construction work, registered with the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, and have an active membership with the Board. The worker should have a permanent total or partial disability caused by illness or an accident.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to registered construction workers with disabilities. Eligible workers receive ₹1,000/- per month for permanent disabilities caused by conditions such as paralysis, leprosy, tuberculosis, or accidents. Additionally, a one-time assistance of ₹75,000/- is granted for total permanent disability, and ₹50,000/- for partial disability.

listings.Scheme Name: Kayaka Spoorthi Scheme Karnataka
listings.Ministries/Departments: Social Welfare Department
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Women Self-Help Groups (SHGs) engaged in the leather industry
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. A Self-Help Group must have at least 10 female artisans. 2. The applicant should belong to specified sub-castes. 3. The age of the applicant should be 18 years. 4. The applicant's annual family income should not exceed ₹30,000/- in rural areas and ₹25,000/- in urban areas. 5. The applicant or their family members must not have received benefits from other schemes, except training programs. 6. The applicant's family members should not be employed in government or semi-government organizations.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to women SHGs for business activities related to the leather industry, promoting self-sufficiency and economic independence. A group of 10 members receives ₹2,50,000/- in total, with each member receiving ₹15,000 as a subsidy and ₹10,000 as a loan.
listings.Application Process: Online application through Seva Sindhu Portal in 7 steps: 1. Registration, 2. Filling out personal and banking details, 3. Uploading required documents, 4. Submitting the application, 5. Tracking application status, 6. Verification by District Co-Ordinator, 7. Approval by District Level Selection Committee.

Benefits include financial assistance of ₹1,12,500/- per batch of 50 farmers for 3 days and exposure to the latest agricultural research and innovations.

listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to start small businesses and empower artisans and improve their livelihoods by providing access to capital to start or expand small-scale enterprises. listings.Scheme Name: Financial Assistance for Education of Children of Beneficiary
listings.Ministries/Departments: Manipur Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Children of labour card holders who are staying in relief camps after the violence following the Tribal Solidarity March on 03.05.2023
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The worker should be registered under the Manipur Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. 2. The worker should hold a valid labour card issued by the MBOCWWB. 3. The worker should be residing in a relief camp due to the violence. 4. Only for families affected by the 03.05.2023 Tribal Solidarity March. 5. The worker should have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year. 6. The student should have enrolled in Higher Secondary or equivalent/B.A./B.Sc/B.Com/Diploma/Post Graduate Degree/Diploma Course/Engineering or Medical Degree.
listings.Description & Benefits: One-time financial assistance of ₹5,000/- for the education of children of labour card holders who are staying in relief camps after the violence following the Tribal Solidarity March on 03.05.2023. This assistance is aimed at easing the financial burden on families displaced by the violence.
listings.Application Process: Offline application process: 1. Visit the Manipur Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form. 2. Fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. 3. Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Relief Camp Nodal Officer/Labour Board Inspector. 4. Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the Relief Camp Nodal Officer or Labour Board Inspector to whom the application has been submitted.
listings.Tags: Children, Construction Worker, Education, Financial Assistance

listings.Scheme Name: Incentive for the Inter Caste Marriage Couple
listings.Ministries/Departments: Karnataka Social Welfare Department
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Scheduled Caste (SC) individuals who marry outside their caste, particularly Hindu non-SC individuals
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The bride and groom should belong to the Hindu Category. 2. The bride and groom should be residing in Karnataka. 3. listings.Description & Benefits: Financial Assistance of ₹2,50,000/- for SC men marrying a woman from another caste and ₹3,00,000/- for SC women marrying a man from another caste. The incentive is provided in two installments: 50% in cash and 50% as a fixed deposit with a minimum term of 3 years.

Obtain a receipt or acknowledgement from the Assistant Labour Commissioner.

listings.Application Process: Online

The widow should belong to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family. 5. The applicant should not be receiving pension benefits under any other social security scheme.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides ₹1,000/- per month to widows aged 40 and above from Below Poverty Line (BPL) families.

listings.Description & Benefits: Uplift lifestyle of economically disadvantaged Charmakar communities, Promotes educational, economic, and social development, Supports production and sale of footwear and leather articles, Provides financial assistance of ₹50,000, Subsidy of ₹10,000, Loan component of ₹40,000 with 5% interest rate
listings.Application Process: Offline, Step 1: Visit District Office of Leather Industries Development Corporation of Maharashtra (LIDCOM), Step 2: Fill application form, Step 3: Submit application form with documents, Step 4: Request receipt or acknowledgement

listings.Scheme Name: Incentive For The Inter Caste Marriage Couple (Scheduled Tribe)
listings.Ministries/Departments: Tribal Welfare Department, Government of Karnataka
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Couples where one partner belongs to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) community and the other partner belongs to either the Hindu non-ST or SC category
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The couple should be residing in Karnataka. 2. The couple should belong to the Hindu religion. 3. One spouse should belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) community. Other spouse should belong to a community other than Scheduled Tribe (ST). 4. The combined annual income of the couple should be less than ₹5,00,000/-. 5. The couple should apply to the scheme within 18 months of marriage. 6. The non-ST partner should be a Hindu. 7. The non-ST partner should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. 8. The marriage should have taken place on or after 7th February 2019.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides incentives to the couple in which one spouse is from a Scheduled Tribe (ST) and the other spouse is non-ST. An incentive of ₹5,50,000/- is provided to the married couple, i.e. ₹3,00,000/- for the bride and ₹2,50,000/- for the groom.
listings.Application Process: Online application through the official website of the Tribal Welfare Department, Government of Karnataka. Steps: 1. Visit the website, 2. Click on 'Incentives for Marriage' and select the 'Incentives to Inter-Caste Marriage' scheme, 3. Fill in the online registration form, 4. Upload mandatory documents, 5. Review and submit the form, 6. Print the acknowledgement form for future reference.
listings.Tags: Inter Caste Marriage, Scheduled Tribe, Incentive, Karnataka, Tribal Welfare Department

The student should be enrolled in Class 1 to 5 in a recognized educational institution. 4. The student should be a regular student of the institution.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to encourage Scheduled Caste students in the field of education and provide financial assistance. A regular student of a recognized institution receives a scholarship amount of ₹200 per year.

listings.Target Beneficiaries: Individual entrepreneurs and registered farmer’s associations

The family should be from the 'Below Poverty Line' category.

listings.Scheme Name: Mukhyamantri Covid-19 Bal Seva Yojana
listings.Ministries/Departments: Women and Child Development Department
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Children whose parents or guardians have died due to coronavirus infection
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The affected family should be a local resident of Madhya Pradesh. 2. The family should not be eligible to avail the benefits of Chief Minister Covid-19 Yodha Kalyan Yojana. 3. The deceased parents of the child beneficiary should not have been government servants or employees of a government undertaking who were eligible to receive pension under the old pension scheme. 4. Such boys/girls whose age is 21 years or less, but till the prescribed duration of graduation course, whichever is less and whose- * Parent has died from COVID-19 or * Parents have died earlier and their legal guardian has died due to Covid-19. * One of the parents has died in the past and now the other has died of Covid-19. * Only During from 01 March 2021 to 30 June 2021

listings.Ministries/Departments: Andhra Pradesh Brahmin Welfare Corporation (ABC) Limited
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Underprivileged Brahmins in Andhra Pradesh, including orphan children, differently-abled individuals, widows, destitute women separated from their husbands, and elderly Brahmins
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The applicant should belong to the Brahmin community and reside in Andhra Pradesh, have a white ration card, annual family income not exceeding ₹75,000/-, and not availed of similar benefits from other government schemes
listings.Description & Benefits: Financial assistance to alleviate the financial burden of food and shelter expenses, including ₹2,000/- to ₹4,000/- per month based on eligibility criteria

listings.Scheme Name: Veda Vyasa Scheme for Vedic Education
listings.Ministries/Departments: Andhra Pradesh Brahmin Welfare Corporation
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Brahmin Community students pursuing Vedic Education
listings.Eligibility Criteria: The student and his parents should belong to the Brahmin community, reside in Andhra Pradesh, and be between 8 to 19 years old. The student should be pursuing a full-time vedic course in a registered Veda Pathasala.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides annual financial assistance to selected applicants. The financial assistance varies from ₹12,000 to ₹36,000 depending on the course and age of the student.
listings.Application Process: Online application through the official website. Applicants need to register, fill out the required details, upload documents, and submit the application.

listings.Scheme Name: Gayathri Scheme for Academic Excellence
listings.Ministries/Departments: Andhra Pradesh Brahmin Welfare Corporation, a Government of Andhra Pradesh undertaking
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Students of Andhra Pradesh, Brahmin community
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The student and his/her parents should belong to the Brahmin community. 2. The parents of the student should reside in Andhra Pradesh. 3. The student must be a regular (Full Time) student of the course for the academic year 2018-19. 4. The student should be the topper of the entire course (at the end of SSC/ Intermediate or equivalent /Graduation /Professional Edn. Course) in the School/ College/ Institute for the academic year 2018-19. 5. The toppers of SSC/ Intermediate or equivalent and Graduation should have completed the course in Andhra Pradesh. However, toppers of Professional Education Course may have completed the course from anywhere in India but the parents should be residing in Andhra Pradesh. 6. The student should not have availed himself/herself of any amount under any other government scheme for the same purpose.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme provides financial assistance to the topper of the school/ College/ Institute for the course. The amount of assistance is ₹7,500/- for SSC, ₹10,000/- for Intermediate or equivalent, ₹15,000/- for Graduation, and ₹20,000/- for Professional Education Course.
listings.Application Process: Online application through the Corporation’s portal by providing the necessary information.
listings.Tags: Education, Financial Assistance, SSC, Student, Brahmin, Andhra Pradesh

listings.Scheme Name: Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme
listings.Ministries/Departments: West Bengal Government, Social Welfare
listings.Target Beneficiaries: Women from economically weaker sections of society
listings.Eligibility Criteria: 1. The applicant should be a resident of West Bengal. 2. The applicant should be a woman. 3. The age of the applicant should be between 25 - 60 years. 4. The household of the applicant should be enrolled under the 'Swasthyasathi' scheme. 5. The applicant should not be a government employee in permanent employment/ retired government employee of Central/ State Government, Statutory Bodies, Government Undertakings, Panchayats, Municipal Corporations/ Municipalities, Local Bodies, teaching and non-teaching employees of Government aided Educational Institutions, etc. receiving regular salary/ pension.
listings.Description & Benefits: The scheme aims to empower women and make them financially independent by providing them with a one-time grant to buy essential goods and services. The grant amount is ₹ 1,200/- per month to women SC/ST households and ₹ 1,000/- per month to other beneficiaries.
listings.Application Process: Offline application through Duare Sarkar Camps. The application form will be available free of cost at the Duare Sarkar Camps. The applicant will submit the filled-in, duly signed application form at one of the Duare Sarkar Camps, along with the self-attested copies of the required documents.
listings.Tags: Financial Assistance, Women Empowerment, Social Welfare
